member.name: T:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper
member.summary: Defines a static helper method to inspect common Object Manager exceptions.
member.remarks: Unfortunately, both Kepler and Object Manager don't provide clear error details to determine whether an exception is both expected and retryable. The method is designed to inspect a limited number of well-known exception types, traverse inner exceptions, and search within the deserialized to find expected .NET exception types. The primary goal is to improve UX by not retrying errors that can never succeed and prevent the export from spinning unnecessarily.

member.name: F:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.MaxInnerExceptionDepth
member.summary: Defines the max depth to search for exceptions.
member.remarks: As a sanity check, limit the number of levels. In practice, the target exceptions types are found within the first 2-3 levels.

member.name: M:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.IsNonFatalError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Inspects the Object Manager exception to determine if the error is non-fatal including invalid request artifacts and server-side directory/path/permission issues.
member.param: The exception to evaluate.
member.returns: indicates the exception is non-fatal and expected; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.IsInvalidParametersError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Inspects the Object Manager exception to determine if the error is due to invalid request parameters such as non-existent artifacts.
member.param: The exception to evaluate.
member.returns: indicates the exception is the expected error; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.IsServerSideDirectoryNotFoundError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Inspects the Object Manager exception to determine if the error is due to the server-side directory not found.
member.param: The exception to evaluate.
member.returns: indicates the exception is the expected error; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.IsServerSideFileNotFoundError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Inspects the Object Manager exception to determine if the error is due to the server-side file not found.
member.param: The exception to evaluate.
member.returns: indicates the exception is the expected error; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.IsServerSideFilePermissionsError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Inspects the Object Manager exception to determine if the error is due to server-side file permissions.
member.param: The exception to evaluate.
member.returns: indicates the exception is the expected error; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Relativity.DataExchange.Service.ObjectManagerExceptionHelper.TrySearchServiceExceptionErrorDetails(System.Exception,System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean})
member.summary: Searches the exception and all inner exceptions up to the max depth using the supplied inner exception function.
member.param: The exception to inspect.
The function called that determines whether the search criteria has been met.
member.returns: if the search is successful; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This method was originally using to serialize the exception to a JSON string and perform a basic string search. Unfortunately, performance was incredibly slow and may be due to using such a legacy version - almost 5 years old as of this writing. The implementation now leverages from the dictionary that's already supplied when the object has been serialized by Kepler.

member.summary: Reads all remaining rows and then closes . This is because the only way to get the total number of records is to read all the rows.

member.name: M:kCura.WinEDDS.ImportExtension.ImageDataReader.CountRecords
member.summary: Returns total records count, but only when already read all the records, otherwise returns null. This is because is a forward-only record viewer and does not contain information about total number of rows. To calculate total number of records we need to iterate through all the rows and increment
member.returns: Total records count if is closed, null otherwise

member.name: M:kCura.WinEDDS.Exporter.LoadColumns
member.summary: Sets the member variable _columns to contain an array of each Field which will be exported. _columns is an array of ViewFieldInfo, but for the "Text Precedence" column, the array item is a CoalescedTextViewField (a subclass of ViewFieldInfo).
member.returns: A string containing the contents of the export file header. For example, if _exportFile.LoadFile is false, and the fields selected to export are (Control Number and ArtifactID), along with the Text Precendence which includes Extracted Text, then the following string would be returned: ""Control Number","Artifact ID","Text Precedence" "

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.AutoNumberImages
member.summary: Determines whether a page number is automatically appended to a page-level identifier.
member.remarks: When this property is set to True, a new incremental number (such as 01, 02) is added to the page-level identifier, creating a unique page number.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.BatesNumberField
member.summary: Defines a column name in the SourceData, which maps to a field used as a unique identifier. If property is not set, default column name "BatesNumber" is used.
member.remarks: This unique identifier may be called Bates Number or Control Number in a database.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.BeginBatesFieldArtifactID
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial integer to be used in Bates Numbering.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.DisableImageLocationValidation
member.summary: Enables or disables validation of image location for the current job.
member.remarks: Set this property to True if you want validation disabled. By default, this property is set to False, so validation is enabled.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.DisableImageTypeValidation
member.summary: Enables or disables validation of the image type for the current job.
member.remarks: Set this property to True if you want validation disabled. By default, this property is set to False, so validation is enabled.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.DocumentIdentifierField
member.summary: Name of the field in the SourceData corresponding to the DocumentIdentifier field. If property is not set, default column name "DocumentIdentifier" is used.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.FileLocationField
member.summary: Indicates the column name in the SourceData that maps to the FileLocation field in Relativity. If property is not set, default column name "FileLocation" is used.
member.remarks: In the data set, this field value should contain a fully-qualified file location path and file name, such as C:\images\image1.jpg or \\servername\images\image1.jpg. The Import API doesn't support multi-page TIFFs.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.FileNameField
member.summary: Indicates the column name in the SourceData that maps to the FileName field in Relativity. If property is not set, default column name "FileName" is used.
member.remarks: In the data set, this field value should contain a original file name with its extension. Original file name is stored in Filename column in File table

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.FolderPathSourceFieldName
member.summary: Indicates the Field name that contains the subfolder used for document imports.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.ForProduction
member.summary: To load images into a production, set this property to True.
member.remarks: If you want to load images into a specific production, set the ProductionArtifactID.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.ImageFilePathSourceFieldName
member.summary: Field name that contains the full path to and filename of an image file.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImageSettings.ProductionArtifactID
member.summary: Indicates a valid ArtifactID for a production set. Used in conjunction with the ForProduction property.
member.remarks: If you want to load images into a specific production, set this property to the ArtifactID of a production set, and set the ForProduction property to True. Use the GetProductionSets method to return a list of ArtifactIDs for available production sets.

member.summary: Get class containing telemetry settings

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.AuditLevel
member.summary: Indicates the level of auditing for an import job.

listheader.description: This property can be set to one of the following values:

item.description: FullAudit - Includes create, update, and delete messages. Snapshot is also enabled, so all current field values (Audit Details) are captured for updates. FullAudit is the default setting.
NoSnapshot - Includes create, update, and delete messages. Snapshot is disabled, so current field values (Audit Details) aren't captured for updates.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.CaseArtifactId
member.summary: Indicates the ArtifactID of the workspace used as the destination for an import job. This property is required.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.CopyFilesToDocumentRepository
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to copy files to the document repository. If False, files will be linked instead.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.DataGridIDColumnName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the column that identifies the record identifier in DataGrid for documents.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.DestinationFolderArtifactID
member.summary: Indicates the Import Destination folder under which documents and objects, as well as folders containing documents or objects, are built.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.DisableExtractedTextEncodingCheck
member.summary: Enables or disables encoding checks for each file.
member.remarks: To use the setting for all extracted text files during import, set this property to True. You can improve import performance by enabling this property, because it bypasses the process of directly detecting the encoding for each file. The default value is False, which indicates that the API will try to determine the encoding of the extracted text file. Use this setting only when you are importing files that all have the same encoding. To avoid unexpected results, don't enable DisableExtractedTextEncodingCheck when you are running an import that uses several different encodings.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.DisableUserSecurityCheck
member.summary: Enables or disables user permission checks per document or object.
member.remarks: Set this property to True if you want to disable security checks. By default, this property is set to False, so security checks are enabled.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.ExtractedTextEncoding
member.summary: Sets the encoding of the extracted text files.
member.remarks: This setting will only be used if DisableExtractedTextEncodingCheck() is set to True.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.ExtractedTextFieldContainsFilePath
member.summary: Indicates whether the Extracted Text field contains a path to the extracted text file or contains the actual extracted text.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.LoadImportedFullTextFromServer
member.summary: Indicates whether the Extracted Text field data will be loaded directly from its file path, rather than as part of a bulk load file.
member.remarks: All Extracted Text files must exactly match the encoding of the Extracted Text field when this is set to True. If extracted text is unicode enabled, the files need to be UTF-16 encoded, otherwise they need to be ANSI. This setting will only be used when is also set to True.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.IdentityFieldId
member.summary: Represents a key field that is set only on Overwrite mode.
member.remarks: Also known as OverlayIdentifierFieldArtifactID; see ImportLoadFileProcess.AuditRun(Boolean,String)

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.MaximumErrorCount
member.summary: Determines the maximum number of errors displayed. This property is optional.
member.remarks: When error count reaches the maximum value, the following message is generated: Maximum number of errors for display reached. For example, if you set this value to 100 for an import containing 150 bad rows, only 101 errors will be produced. The first 100 errors are those generated by the bad rows, while the 101st error is the maximum errors message. If you want to use this optional value, set it to greater than 0 and less than Int32.MaxValue. The default value is 999.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.NativeFileCopyMode
member.summary: Indicates whether native files are used as links or copied to the Relativity instance designated as the destination.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.OverwriteMode
member.summary: Indicates whether records should be appended or overlaid. The default mode is Append.
member.remarks: To set this property, see OverwriteModeEnum for a list of values.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.ParentObjectIdSourceFieldName
member.summary: Indicates the name of the Field that contains a unique identifier for the record of the parent object associated with the current record.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.RelativityPassword
member.summary: Provides the password for logging in to the Relativity instance used as a destination.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.RelativityUsername
member.summary: Provides the username for logging in to the Relativity instance used as a destination.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.SelectedIdentifierFieldName
member.summary: Specifies the field to be used as an identifier while importing.
member.remarks: If this identifier cannot be resolved, the control number will be used in its place.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.SendEmailOnLoadCompletion
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to send an email to notify you of load completion.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.WebServiceURL
member.summary: Specifies the server where the Relativity WebAPI is installed. This property is optional.
member.remarks: This property defaults to the value set in the Windows registry by the Relativity Desktop Client.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.StartRecordNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the record number from which to start the import.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.ObjectFieldIdListContainsArtifactId
member.summary: Identifies a list of single or multiple object Fields that should be mapped by ArtifactID instead of by name.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.OverlayBehavior
member.summary: Indicates the method for overlay imports with multiple choice and multiple object fields.
member.value: This property can be set to one of the following values: UseRelativityDefaults: each field will be imported based on its overlay behavior settings in Relativity. MergeAll: new imported values will be added to all imported fields. ReplaceAll: all the imported fields previous values will all be overwritten with the imported values.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.MoveDocumentsInAppendOverlayMode
member.summary: Indicates if existing documents in case of Append/Overlay mode should be moved to new folder based on metadata

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.Billable
member.summary: Indicates if imported files are subjects to being billable.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.ImportSettingsBase.ApplicationName
member.summary: Allows clients of Import API to identify themselves. This property is used for telemetry purpose.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings
member.summary: Provides settings to manage the import process.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.ArtifactTypeId
member.summary: Indicates the ArtifactTypeId of the destination object. This property is required.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.BulkLoadFileFieldDelimiter
member.summary: Field delimiter to use when writing out the bulk load file.
member.remarks: Line delimiters will be this value plus a line feed.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.DisableControlNumberCompatibilityMode
member.summary: Enables or disables the use of "Control Number" to override the SelectedIdentifierField.
member.remarks: If True, tries to use "Control Number" for the SelectedIdentifierField and ignores SelectedIdentifierField. If False and SelectedIdentifierField is not set, uses the default identifier field.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.DisableExtractedTextFileLocationValidation
member.summary: Enables or disables validation of the extracted text file location.
member.remarks: Set this property to True if you want validation disabled. If validation is disabled and an extracted text file doesn't exist, the current job will fail. By default, this property is set to False, so validation is enabled.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.DisableNativeLocationValidation
member.summary: Enables or disables the validation of the native file location for the current import job.
member.value: Set this property to True if you want validation disabled. By default, this property is set to False, so validation is enabled.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.DisableNativeValidation
member.summary: Enables or disables validation of the native file type for the current job.
member.remarks: Set this property to True if you want validation disabled. By default, this property is set to False, so validation is enabled. Before disabling validation, you may want to confirm that your files are all supported types and that the native file paths in the load files are correct. Otherwise, you may encounter the following issues: When file type validation is disabled, you won't receive any warnings about unsupported file types, so these files may be imaged and result in errors. Disabled file type validation also causes the application to set the Relativity Native Types field to Unknown Format. When file location validation is disabled, the Import API may temporarily stop and then restart if the load file includes paths that do not contain files. The Import API will also stop when the load file doesn't include a path for a native file, but it will load any files prior to encountering this issue.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.FolderPathSourceFieldName
member.summary: Indicates the name of a metadata field used to build the folder structure for the workspace.
member.remarks: All folders are built under the Import Destination folder, indicated by the DestinationFolderArtifactID. If a folder matching the entered string already exists, the documents will be added to it; otherwise, the folder(s) (including nested folders) will be created and the documents will be imported into the new folder(s).

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.LongTextColumnThatContainsPathToFullText
member.summary: Specify a column other than ExtractedText that contains a path to a full text file

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.MultiValueDelimiter
member.summary: Represents the delimiter used to separate multiple values, such as different single-choice field values.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.NativeFilePathSourceFieldName
member.summary: Indicates the name of the Field that contains the full path and filename for the native files.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.NestedValueDelimiter
member.summary: Represents the delimiter used to separate nested values, such as choices or child choices on a multi-choice field.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.RowCount
member.summary: This property is not used and will be unavailable in future releases.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.OIFileIdMapped
member.summary: To skip file identification, set this property to True.
member.remarks: If this value is True, both OIFileIdColumnName and OIFileTypeColumnName must be set.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.OIFileIdColumnName
member.summary: Indicates the column that contains the OutsideInFileId on the SourceData property. Used in conjunction with the OIFileIdMapped and FileSizeMapped properties.
member.remarks: If OIFileIdMapped or FileSizeMapped is set to True, set this property to the value that indicates the SourceData column that contains the OutsideInFileId. To determine the file ID, call the Relativity.DataExchange.Io.FileTypeIdentifierService.Instance.Identify() method.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.OIFileTypeColumnName
member.summary: Indicates the column that contains the OutsideInFileType on the SourceData property. Used in conjunction with the OIFileIdMapped property.
member.remarks: If the OIFileIdMapped property is to True, set this property to the value that indicates the SourceData column that contains the OutsideInFileType. To determine the file type, call the Relativity.DataExchange.Io.FileTypeIdentifierService.Instance.Identify() method.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.FileSizeMapped
member.summary: To skip file size checking, set this property to True.
member.remarks: If this value is True, OIFileIdColumnName and FileSizeColumn must be mapped.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.FileSizeColumn
member.summary: Indicates the column that contains the FileSize on the SourceData property.
member.remarks: To use this property, FileSizeMapped must be set to True.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.FileNameColumn
member.summary: Indicates the column that contains the name of the file on the SourceData property.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.DataReaderClient.Settings.SupportedByViewerColumn
member.summary: Indicates the column that contains the SupportedByViewer on the SourceData property.
member.remarks: To use this property, OIFileIdMapped must be set to True and OIFileIdColumnName must be empty.

member.summary: To allow a custom time logging method through out the API

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.ImportAPI.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Uses the Password Authentication provider when and are specified; otherwise, Integrated Authentication provider.
member.remarks: User name and password are required (unless using Integrated Security) and will be validated. The ImportAPI tries to resolve the server name by reading the WebServiceURL key from the local app.config file. If this fails, it checks the Windows Registry for the location set by the Relativity Desktop Client.
member.param: The Relativity login user name.
The Relativity login password.
member.exception: Thrown when integrated security is not supported when running within a service process.
Thrown when an authentication failure occurs.
The exception thrown when this API version isn't supported with the specified Relativity instance.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.ImportAPI.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Uses the Password Authentication provider when and are specified; otherwise, Integrated Authentication provider.
member.remarks: User name and password are required (unless using Integrated Security) and will be validated against the Relativity WebAPI instance located at .
member.param: The Relativity login user name.
The Relativity login password.
The URL to the Relativity WebAPI instance.
member.exception: Thrown when integrated security is not supported when running within a service process.
Thrown when an authentication failure occurs.
The exception thrown when this API version isn't supported with the specified Relativity instance.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.ImportAPI.CreateByRsaBearerToken(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class. Uses the bearer token for the current and should only be used by processes hosted by the Relativity Service Account (IE Agent).
member.param: The URL to the Relativity WebAPI instance.
member.exception: Thrown when integrated security is not supported when running within a service process.
Thrown when the current claims principal does not have an access token or an authentication failure occurs.
The exception thrown when this API version isn't supported with the specified Relativity instance.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.ImportAPI.CreateByBearerToken(System.String,System.String)

The bearer token used to authenticate both WebAPI and REST API endpoints.
member.exception: Thrown when bearer token authentication failure occurs.

member.summary: Creates an ImageImportBulkArtifactJob with which to import a set of images.
member.remarks: Setting the user name and password property for the job is not required, because the credentials are pre-populated.

member.remarks: Setting the user name and password property for the job is not required, because the credentials are pre-populated.
member.param: Artifact ID of the production set to hold the imported images.
member.returns: The instance with set to true and set to .

member.remarks: Setting the user name and password property for the job is not required, because the credentials are pre-populated.

member.summary: The field is multireflected.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldCategoryEnum.Batch
member.summary: The field represents the grouping mechanism for a batch.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the type of data that a field can hold.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Empty
member.summary: The field can hold nothing.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.VarChar
member.summary: The field holds a set of characters of variable length.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Integer
member.summary: The field holds a whole number.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Date
member.summary: The field holds a date in the format "MM/DD/YYYY h:mm XM".

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Boolean
member.summary: The field holds a value of Yes or No.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Text
member.summary: The field holds some amount of text.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Code
member.summary: The field represents a single value selected from a list.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Decimal
member.summary: The field holds a decimal number.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Currency
member.summary: The field represents an amount of currency.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.MultiCode
member.summary: The field represents a number of values selected from a list.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.File
member.summary: The field holds a file.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Object
member.summary: The field holds an object.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.User
member.summary: The field identifies a user.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.LayoutText
member.summary: The field holds text for a layout. Do not use.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.FieldTypeEnum.Objects
member.summary: The field is a multiple object field; it defines a relationship between multiple objects.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.UploadTypeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the file upload mode used by the Import API.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.UploadTypeEnum.Web
member.summary: Uploads files through the web server. This is the standard mode.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.ImportAPI.Enumeration.UploadTypeEnum.Direct
member.summary: Uploads files directly.
member.remarks: This mode is significantly faster than Web mode. It requires specific Windows group permissions and a connection to the network hosting the data. If an upload in this mode fails, the system reverts to Web mode.
